revised_title: Anatomy and Development of Stomodaeum, Mesenterial Filaments, and Endoderm in Xenia
tldr: The author examines the anatomy and development of the stomodaeum, mesenterial filaments, and endoderm in the Xenia coral. They discover gland cells in the stomodaeum and the absence of the six ventral and lateral mesenterial filaments, suggesting a correlation between these findings and the presence of gland cells in the stomodaeum.
